importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The day the coalition agreement between the LDP and JIP is reported, marking a pivotal moment in Japan's political transition.
The day the potential election of Sanae Takaichi as prime minister is imminent, with the vote possibly occurring as early as Tuesday.
The day before Donald Trump's arrival in Japan, highlighting geopolitical significance of Japan's political shift during a high-profile international visit.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the coalition agreement is being finalized and the vote on prime ministerial leadership may occur.

keyTakeAways: Sanae Takaichi, the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), is set to become Japan’s first female prime minister if a coalition with the Japan Innovation Party (JIP) is formed.
The coalition between the LDP and JIP is critical to restoring a majority in the Diet, as both parties are currently two seats short of a majority.
The coalition agreement is expected to be finalized by Monday, with the JIP holding internal meetings to approve the alliance.
The collapse of the LDP's previous coalition, including the departure of Komeito after 26 years, created a political crisis and opened the door for this new alliance.
If the vote goes to a second round, Takaichi would only need more support than the other candidate to win.
This political shift occurs just days before U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to Japan, adding international attention to the event.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Japan’s governing Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), led by Sanae Takaichi, is set to form a coalition with the Japan Innovation Party (JIP), led by Hirofumi Yoshimura, in an effort to secure a majority in the Diet and enable Takaichi to become Japan’s first female prime minister. The move follows the collapse of the previous coalition after Komeito’s exit, creating a political crisis. Although the coalition is two seats short of a majority, a second-round vote would allow Takaichi to win with more support than the other candidate. This political shift occurs just days before U.S. President Donald Trump’s visit to Japan, adding international attention and diplomatic significance to the event.
title: Japan coalition set to back Takaichi as first woman prime minister: Reports
